title: Space Development Agency solicits bids for 54 missile-tracking satellites
summary: The Space Development Agency on Sept. 5 released a solicitation for 54 satellites equipped with infrared sensors capable of tracking hypersonic missiles in all phases of flight.

title: Starship is stacked and ready to make its second launch attempt
summary: During this test flight, Starship will carry no payloads.

title: Ariane 6 Core Stage Breathes Fire for the First Time
summary:
ESA, the French Space Agency CNES, and project prime ArianeGroup completed the first shot hot fire test of an Ariane 6 core stage. The test was completed in the late afternoon on 5 September from the Ariane 6 ELA4 launch complex of the Guiana Space Centre. The testing involved a full launch sequence and final […]
The post Ariane 6 Core Stage Breathes Fire for the First Time appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Eutelsat invests in Europe-focused space technology venture fund
summary: Eutelsat has invested in French venture capital firm Karista’s space technology fund to strengthen ties with startups across Europe, the satellite operator said Sept. 5.

title: Ariane 6 completes short-duration engine test
summary: ESA and ArianeGroup announced a successful hot-fire test of the core stage of the Ariane 6 rocket, the first of two such tests before ESA is ready to set a date for the rocket’s inaugural launch.

title: Terran Orbital unveils seven standard satellite buses
summary: Terran Orbital developed the new standards based on satellites the company has produced for civil, defense and commercial customers.

title: Chandrayaan-3 success to boost India’s space ambitions, global standing
summary: The technical success of India’s Chandrayaan-3 lunar lander mission could help not just India’s space program but also the country’s standing on the global stage, experts argue.

title: Project Kuiper partners with Vodafone in Europe and Africa
summary: Vodafone plans to test beta services from Amazon’s planned Project Kuiper broadband constellation next year to extend the reach of its cellular networks in Europe and Africa.

title: Firefly selected to launch three L3Harris satellites
summary: Firefly Aerospace signed an agreement with L3Harris Technologies to launch three small satellites aboard Firefly’s Alpha rocket, the company announced Sept. 5.

title: India Says Good Night To Chandrayaan-3
summary: India’s Chandrayaan-3 lunar probe has completed its primary mission and is now in sleep mode. The solar-powered Vikram lander and Pragyan rover were not designed to survive the lunar night, […]
